channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BEAM-10974] Flink PortableValidatesRunner test failure: GroupByKeyTest$BasicTests.testLargeKeys10MB
item.description:
Error Message

java.lang.RuntimeException: The Runner experienced the following error during execution: java.io.IOException: Cannot write record to fresh sort buffer. Record too large.

Stacktrace

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Hi Maximilian, could you please take a look at this failure?
ibzib
Maybe this is not really a blocker? I am not sure.

The first failure I can find is here: https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_PVR_Flink_Batch/5393/

I suspect this was caused by https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12708.
It doesn't look like https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12708 is related since that changes pipeline execution for non-portable Flink yet the failing test is for portable Flink.

Thanks Luke, you're right. I tried bisecting and found that commits prior to https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12708 and https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12706 also failed.

Compare the first failing build with the last passing build*:

https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_PVR_Flink_Batch/5393/testReport/org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms/
https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_PVR_Flink_Batch/5387/testReport/org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms/

We can see that before, GroupByKeyTest was not being run at all. I'm not sure why, but my bisect shows the upgrade to Gradle 6.6.1 (https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12776) somehow caused GroupByKeyTest to become included. My guess is it's related to GroupByKeyTest running with the junit Enclosed test runner [1].

The fact that 100MB keys are excluded [2] seems to indicate that 10MB keys must have worked at some time in the past. But I can't seem to run GroupByKeyTest at all prior to the Gradle upgrade. I get an error message:

> No tests found for given includes: [**/JvmVerification.class](exclude rules) [org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.GroupByKeyTest$BasicTests.testLargeKeys10MB](filter.includeTestsMatching)

So I am unable to determine yet when this regression might have actually occurred.

  • Note that there are some builds missing in between, because these issues started right around the time for which Jenkins is starting to trash old jobs.

[1] https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/64d8c8006c4aa633438863eab15078b22b6d85ac/sdks/java/core/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/GroupByKeyTest.java#L91
[2] https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/27f4836be06f38daf5741847c77e557b8b26a201/runners/flink/job-server/flink_job_server.gradle#L144

This one can be fixed by adjusting Flink's managed memory size: https://ci.apache.org/projects/flink/flink-docs-release-1.11/ops/config.html#taskmanager-memory-managed-size

In recent releases, this was changed to be configured as a fraction of the total memory by default. This is why we see the regression.

Thank you all for looking into this issue! Sounds like this is not a regression from 2.24.0? If not, could we let the fix go to 2.26.0, according to https://beam.apache.org/contribute/release-guide/#review-cherry-picks?
This is the only issue left that is blocking 2.25.0 release. If this is not a new regression from 2.24.0? Could we wait until 2.26.0 for the fix to go in? WDYT mxm
Sounds like this is failing because of a Flink change, not a Beam change. So it should not block the release.
I see. I will change the fix version to 2.26.0

Is this still a real blocker for the 2.26 release as it didn't block the 2.25 release?
It doesn't seem fixed. Should it be bumped to the next cut?
Will this be a regression for all users of the FlinkRunner on past versions? Do users generally set this flag themselves anyhow so they are not affected?

Removed fix version as I do not believe this should block the 2.26, or any other release. I don't think our test embedded Flink configuration is at all representative of "real" clusters when it comes to memory availability.

This issue is assigned but has not received an update in 30 days so it has been labeled "stale-assigned". If you are still working on the issue, please give an update and remove the label. If you are no longer working on the issue, please unassign so someone else may work on it. In 7 days the issue will be automatically unassigned.

This Jira ticket has a pull request attached to it, but is still open. Did the pull request resolve the issue? If so, could you please mark it resolved? This will help the project have a clear view of its open issues.
This issue has been migrated to https://github.com/apache/beam/issues/20655
